content.question: A <math alttext="10 ohm" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math> resistor has a current that varies with time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> according to the equation <math alttext="I of t, equals I sub 0, end sub, times e raised to the negative alpha t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>α</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></math>, where <math alttext="I sub 0, equals 4 amps" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="alpha equals 2 inverse seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>. What is the total energy dissipated in the resistor between <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> and a long time later?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
